qas.question: When was Mexico City declared the capital?
How large was the area the federal government would proclaim to be the capital?
Where was the state government located when Mexico City was declared the capital?
What is the Palace of the Inquisition known as now?
Where was the government of Mexico City moved to at the time it was declared capital of Mexico?

context: Due in large part to the persuasion of representative Servando Teresa de Mier, Mexico City was chosen because it was the center of the country's population and history, even though Querétaro was closer to the center geographically. The choice was official on <a0_0>November 18, 1824<a0_0/>, and Congress delineated a surface area of <a1_0>two leagues square (8,800 acres)<a1_0/> centered on the Zocalo. This area was then separated from the State of Mexico, forcing that state's government to move from the <a2_0>Palace of the Inquisition<a2_0/> (now <a3_0>Museum of Mexican Medicine<a3_0/>) in the city to <a4_0>Texcoco<a4_0/>. This area did not include the population centers of the towns of Coyoacán, Xochimilco, Mexicaltzingo and Tlalpan, all of which remained as part of the State of Mexico.
